intro: Tripolium imbricatum, commonly known as the common sandspurry, is a low-growing flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal areas and disturbed ground. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers with five petals, typically blooming in the spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it has a sprawling growth habit. Tripolium imbricatum is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
